Title: June Fourth at 35, Australian Views on China
Description: In April 1989, Chinese students began mass demonstrations for political reform and free speech, garnering widespread support from workers, intellectuals, and ordinary citizens. By May, one million people had gathered in Tiananmen Square. The protests shocked the Communist Party, prompting a brutal crackdown that killed hundreds,

Title: A nun in Pakistan's National Commission on the Status of Women
Description: Appointed by Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif, Sr Maryam Parween has been defending women's rights for many years. Under her leadership, the Catholic's Women Organisation in Pakistan has raised awareness on issues such as gender-based violence, forced conversions, and child marriage. For activist Kashif Aslam, she is an 'invaluable asset to both the Catholic Church and the community.'
